text:
We are facing an issue when we create a new contact and a new deal through Zapier, it shows the original source in the contact card as "Offline source". (Calendly)

In case someone arrived through Google, Facebook, Instagram or other channels it shows the source which is great but in this case we are loosing the original source that super critical for us to measure from where the lead has arrived.

We talked with HS support and they were explaining that we need to have some code that will solve this issue.

Have you ever heard about it? Do you think that you have the solution to solve it? (It is belong to Zapier <> HubSpot API)

We would love to know more than that so we would be able have like a tracking script which track how the contacts were created.

Kindly, let me know if anyone knows how to assist!

How to get HubSpot account URL (e.g.<https://app-eu2.HubSpot.com>) via API? Or at least “app-eu2” part

I’m trying to create UI links for each contact
```url = `<https://app.HubSpot.com/contacts/${hubId}/${objectType}/${object.id}>````
but the URL might be different (<https://app-eu2.HubSpot.com> or <https://app.HubSpot.com> or other). That’s why I need to know account URL or at least subdomain part which includes location

hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face: im not a developer, and as such am really struggling to find a solution to a challenge I have.

i'm trying to build a custom object to represent our products, because line items just dont have the capabilities we need (i've tried a lot here)

i've written up the schema and opened up postman to try and create the custom object, but i cant get authorisation using my portal's API key.

do i need to create a developer account to do this? and if so how do i associate the custom object with my actual portal?

Hello everyone!

I'm new here so not sure if this is the correct place to ask but I'll give it a shot.
Please tell me otherwise! :slightly_smiling_face:

We're using the User provisioning API to create new users.

This is the endpoint we’re using (see under Endpoints -> Add a user [POST]):
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>

It works fine to create the users, the problem is with the welcome emails.
We don't want to send any emails, but even though I specify `sendWelcomeEmail: false` the mails get sent anyway... :confused:

Other fields in the POST payload make a difference, like setting the `roleId`,  but `sendWelcomeEmail` seems to be ignored?
I've also tried sending `"false"` (as a string) etc but with no luck.

Does anyone here know something about how to turn off these welcome emails?

As I far as I know there is no such an API endpoint.
<@U7SL518D6> Is that right?
you shouldnt need a developer's account.  what is the error that you are seeing?

I don’t think there’s a way to get that. I understand your intent though - being able to generate a link to a specific CRM record within HubSpot from your app seems useful.

I will check internally to see if there’s an intended way for folks to do this.

One thing that may work but is slightly more friction for the end user.
```<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/contacts/${objectType}/${object.id}>```
This will generate a link that prompts the user to select a HubSpot account they’re apart of to open that screen in the app. I don’t know that the object type and id though will be passed properly.
This message was deleted.
<@U02QB3JAM7G> you’re in luck. I’m going to DM you about handling this. For anyone who’s running into this same situation, please watch the changelog for updates.
hi dennis - managed to fix it, thanks! for reference - in postman i needed to use "hapikey" instead of just pasting the key
Thank you <@U7SL518D6> :pray:
It does. I guess the time has come for me to ditch PHP and use Node :grinning:

Can anyone else confirm that the `overwrite` flag for `/files/v3/files/import-from-url/async` is ignored?

```{
    "folderId":"61561461931",
    "access":"PUBLIC_INDEXABLE",
    "url":"<https://www.linkedin.com/>...",
    "overwrite":true,
    "name":"jobs.xml"
}```

You can’t go with an empty redirect URL. You should pick one.
Here is the link to the doc <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>
Ah, confirmed <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Files-API-Overwrite-not-behaving/m-p/537006>

Hey!

Does anyone know a way to order line item display order when creating from the batch api?
I’ve tried re-ordering the array, and that doesn’t work. Can’t find any documentation for it. :shrug:
`hs_position_on_quote`
if code is an issue, and this needs to occur ongoing, zapier would be my suggestion

Hi, i’am trying to integrate HobSpot Engagement API (meeting) in my website where i have a custom booking form. I tested the meeting creation endpoint, but no event was created in my integrated outlook calendar.

I don’t really understand why the Engagement Meeting API features wouldn’t reflect the meeting tool’s features.

I’m i missing something? Thanks
